website_summaries.verdict: Though it isn't as thin or as sturdy, the Asus Transformer Pad TF300 delivers Prime levels of performance at a more affordable price.
pros: The Asus Transformer Pad TF300's Tegra 3-induced performance more or less matches the Transformer Prime's and goes a step further with a better rear camera, faster Wi-Fi performance, a more responsive screen, and an actual (and official) GPS feature
Micro-HDMI and microSD return, as does the keyboard option
The $350 entry price makes the TF300 the best full-Android tablet value currently on the market
cons: The tablet's design isn't as thin, sturdy, or sexy as the Transformer Prime's and feels a bit hollow in comparison
The screen isn't outside-friendly, like the Prime's

customer_reviews.title: its great..
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough review because I'm torn on this tablet. On one hand, its great...but on the other, i am very frustrated with what i think is a software issue. As a tablet, its great. very clear photo, great use for camera, video (skype etc) and reading books/magazines which i primarily use it for. The issue i have is this...since day 1, the tablet freezes and apps need to be "killed"...they just stop. I'm thinking its a software issue and will contact Asus so i dont want to give the tablet itself a bad review, but its certainly frustrating. Will update when i know more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What can I say... GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Have worked Android for years. Have two other tablets... multible phones.... THIS IS BEST.... Opt for T300 for faster speed (Could not justify 700) The quad core handles the slowest Apps with speed. Matched with keyboard dock.. it blows away all other.. GOOGLE PLAY makes it update-able with you already purchased apps. Comes with quality apps installed... Lacking only a Good Navigation program for the excellent GPS built in... Standard Navigation was not pre installed though Google maps does a second rate job, I installed a freebee Navigator from Google Play with offline maps.... Tethers nicely with phone.. Sim slot available. Team with keyboard for up to 15hours on battery.
customer_reviews.author: Fred J. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: I don't use my laptop anymore
customer_reviews.text: I use this tablet with the transformer keyboard for reviewing slides, studying, and typing notes in proffesional school classes. Although android itself is not always the best for functionality, the portability and functionality of the tablet/keyboard is amazing--I can type notes in class, or detach the tablet to review ppt slides, etc. The tablet itself has been fast and working well for the past 10 months. I like the color, and after using the textured plastic back cover I would not want anything else for durability or appearance. It will tip over forwards easily when docked to the keyboard, but I got used to keeping a hand over the keyboard or setting it where it isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Especially when bought in conjunction with the keyboard / battery dock,. Very fast processing running latest Android Jelly Bean out of the box. Fast graphics. Like night and day compared to the old 10" Archos 101 tablet bought two years ago. Definitely provides more features and use than the iPad while still being cheaper. Only odd thing is Google Maps gets you spot on with the internal GPS, but the default weather app seems to always pick a city 200+ miles away. Cannot override the auto-pick except with a manual, forced city that then will not change as the tablets location changes. An oddity not likely a function of the tablet hardware or Asus.
customer_reviews.author: SurplusGadgets

customer_reviews.title: Before update to Jelly Bean and now that it died after just over a year of use.....I would have given it 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I was really getting into this tablet and then poof! Walked out of room to get a drink...it hibernated....it never came back. Been acting weird since I updated to Jelly Bean....for all of you with Icecreamsandwich....STAY WITH IT!!!! Real shame I was even figuring out how to make it more useful than just a viewer/reader. I think I will not be looking at tablets until they are more stable. If you do buy this product make sure you get 2 or more year warranty. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Maniak

customer_reviews.title: T300
customer_reviews.text: I am loving the tablet. I have had for a week now. Went with this model because of the Primes metal back cover blocking wifi signals. Nvidia Tegra 3 mobile processor is lightning fast and the graphics are stunning. The browser seems to keep crashing but with just one click and it is back up with all tabs in place. Seems to be more software than hardware. Also when the battery goes dead then you try to start it after charging it seems to not want to turn on. But when it does come on, you forget about that with the ultra speed and sleekness. Keep up the great job ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Landon

customer_reviews.title: Poor Performance, Construction, and Service
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this product and the service relating to it are terrible. I had to return the tablet 4 times for the same problems, and each time it was returned to me with more problems! Customer service reps are nice, but completely powerless to do anything other than have you return the product for service. No one offers you the option of returning for a refund and, when asked for that option, the only response given is they will give you a RMA number, which means you are returning it for repair, not refund. I've requested a refund twice and been completely ignored. ASUS came highly recommended, but I wouldn't buy another ASUS product on a bet.
customer_reviews.author: DM in OC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing. I had it since it was released and by far it has beat my exceptions. HD movies look beautiful and it's super fast. Screen is very responsive and built well. Daughter dropped it twice and it still in excellent shape. I would recommend this tablet any day. I owned Samsung 7.0 plus and this one feels better overall. The fact that it is pretty much stock 4.0 is great. Doesn't feel as laggy as Samsung's touchwiz, although I would also recommend 7.0 plus if looking for smaller tablet. I do wish the sd card slot had a small door like samsungs tablet but that's personally preference.
customer_reviews.author: nj_rams_fan

customer_reviews.title: iWhat??
customer_reviews.text: I have the iPad2 and the Asus TF300T. The Asus blows the iPad2 away: not handcuffed to Apple better wifi reception records in 1080p better web browser optional keyboard dock that also extends battery life and gives you an extra SD card port and a usb port widescreen, not 4:3 like the ipad2 better camera The Asus has 3 modes of operation, performance mode, balanced and power saving mode I can play any song or video I wish without having to go through iTunes. Dosbox runs on it (among others) run out of space? no problem, slap in another micro SD card. HDMI adapter for the iPad2, $35... HDMI adapter for the TF300, $5.00 I could go on and on.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbes

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but there is room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I got mine yesterday and I do love it. It's speedy and responsive and everything works. Just a couple of thoughts: 1) I'm not a fan of the proprietary charging cable AND USB/Wall plug. Do micro-USBs not provide enough power? I would love an adapter that would let me use the same charger that all my other electronics (and my HP Touchpad) use. 2) There are two spots of LED bleed on the bottom edge of the device. Not noticeable when it's on, but unmistakable when the screen is dark. Otherwise, it's beautiful, light, functional and zippy.
customer_reviews.author: Mary I. Silveus

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this tablet!! It is easy to carry, has great apps already included, does everything I need and more. I don't see the light around the edges of the screen some other buyers have mentioned. It doesn't come with an HDMI cable, but I finally got around to buying one today. And I had several questions before I bought this tablet - the Amazon.com community was really helpful. If you have questions before buying, don't hesitate to ask - someone will get back to you with the answer. Can't say enough good about this item. Really excellent value. Buy this!!
customer_reviews.author: SanDiego.AZ

customer_reviews.title: I was astonished it was like new even the packaging If I didn't know it ...
customer_reviews.text: When I saw the price for this refurbished ASUS transformer I though I was going to get one with spot and blemishes on the screen and encasement or it wouldn't function well. But when I got it. I was astonished it was like new even the packaging If I didn't know it I would think it was. I have used it about a month and love it I am going to remember the reseller (Matte) for other items. I want everybody to know that Amazon resellers are the best and their prices are very competitive it was on $131.49. You can not be that at all. Try Matte and Amazon I know you will like them..
customer_reviews.author: EJtheQuick

customer_reviews.title: awesome, awesome tablet
customer_reviews.text: i had wanted a tablet that is an upgrade from my 1st tablet, a nice size keyboard, and a long lasting battery life. i got what i wanted in this tablet! i haven't timed how long it lasts on the battery but it being hooked to the keyboard sure helps it last even longer. the keyboard is the perfect size for my hands to not be so close together i can't type like other netbook keyboards (this was a worry for me). the only real down side to me is that the charger cord is ridiculously short!!! so i'm extra grateful the battery lasts so long, i'd hate to have it charging constantly on a short-as-hell cord.
customer_reviews.author: M.W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but minor issue.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new tablet. I just received it this past Saturday. The only issue I have with it so far is the minor light bleeding issue. Now, don't go ahead thinking that you shouldn't buy it because of this issue. You can only see it on black backgrounds or on very dark colors. Mine is up along the edge near the camera. If you have a bright wallpaper you won't even notice unless you boot your tablet up. It really isn't that big of a deal. Now, performance wise the tablet works great. It's very fast and responsive. Great with games, drawing, etc. I would definitely recommend this tablet. 4.5/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan R

customer_reviews.title: Best budget tablet out there
customer_reviews.text: Between this and the dock/keyboard/battery, it easily has the best battery life of any tablet, netbook, and I'll wager it even takes on phones. My only gripe with it yet has been getting Yahoo messenger video plugin to work. When you try to install it from the google play store, it doesn't let you, saying it's not compatible; when you load the APK separately, it does work, but the image is tilted sideways... A fairly common issue with some android devices; but I have a feeling it's more of a Yahoo messenger problem than anything. An override setting to point out which way is "up" would go a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Fosters

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet - desktop power (almost) with laptop convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I wish this notification to review this product included the vendor details. I am very pleased with how she packaged the tablet and handled the whole transaction. Superior value! This ASUS TF300 tablet is incredibly powerful for its size. My wife loved it so much I broke down and bought one for myself. The tablet is speedy, manageable size, great features, easy and intuitive navigation; the external keyboard is a must, but the onboard digital keyboard is adequate. My issue there is that the digital keyboard is so big, there is not much realestate left on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Hos

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Transformer TF300
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet! I spent a lot of time researching before buying this tablet, and it was very nearly exactly what I needed. Unfortunately, the two main business software applications I planned to use require a Windows OS. We found a really nice app that would do a fairly good job replacing Quicken, but we didn't want to have to start all over from scratch. The Asus itself is wonderful to use. True, the recharge cord could be a bit longer. We bought the keyboard to get the extra battery life, and it is good for that, but the keyboard itself does not work well unless it is on a perfectly flat, stable surface.
customer_reviews.author: wkwebb

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Great Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this tablet. I do not think it is flimsy at all. It has a very bright screen and the colors are vivid. Never hung on me. battery is pretty good...about 6 hours...I do not get the full 8 hours. The sounds and video is great!! I love that fact that I can doc it.. and use it as a notebook, then undock and use as a tablet. It does take some time getting use to the touch screen, but that is the future. I am very please with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Curran

customer_reviews.title: Android > ipad
customer_reviews.text: I work with ipads, but are very limited by apples policy. Customization is near impossible. The ipads are way to expensive. I ordered this tablet for 349.99 for 32gb of storage and tegra 3 chip. Add leather cover, screen protector and another 32gb micro sd card with stylus pen came out less than 425.00. IF i had gone with apple it would have been another 200-300 dollars for the 64gb model. It has the same apps or better ones than app store. Customization is awesome. I can see any video type or picture type and not tethered to apple store rules.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: At first I LOVED these tablet
customer_reviews.text: At first I LOVED these tablet.... but now after having used it for a year, the base connectors are NOT sturdy enough for everyday use, I have problems with it keeping connected to my STRONG WIFI signal, and worse of all i got it to connect to on-line classes, which doesn't allow me to. I also thought it came with Microsoft word for me to use for school... which it does not.... but the camera is amazing and so is the recorder, face time chat is awesome.... and it is the best tablet i have for games, and tv time.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Swolley

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted in a Tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been comtemplating getting an Android-based tablet for almost a year. I also needed a new computer. The Asus Transformer can be everything I need... a tablet and (with the optional keyboard docking station) a small laptop. I use it both at work and at home. It fits the bill for both. At work, it has increased my productivity. I'm not a techie at all, so I'm sure this apparatus has capabilities that I haven't even discovered. I haven't had problems at all with the applications, Wi-fi, or other functions. I have an Android-based phone, so this was easy to use right out of the box. I do recommend the docking station.
customer_reviews.author: Cande Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: Great option
customer_reviews.text: The price is great, I have used this tablet for video watching, and taking notes at an all day convention. I was able to take notes faster than i could before by hand on paper and pen. the battery life was more than adequate. I turned the pad on eco mode and turned onto basically Airplane mode by turning off GPS, Wifi, Sound, Auto Sync and Auto Rotate. But i finished each day with over 50% battery life. Gaming on this is awesome as well. I have noticed though that the wifi signal is not as strong as it should be compared with other items, but over all this is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice 10" Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I usually read for an hour or so each night when I go to bed and this tablet with its mobile dock only needs charged every four days or so. The screen is plenty bright and clear for reading and if I take the mobile dock off and turn this on its side I can get a full magazine page at a time on the screen with the type large enough for me to easily read it. My only complaint with it is that its wireless doesn't seem to make as good of a connection as it should. I have a pretty strong wireless signal in my bedroom but this tablet seems to often drop the signal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow sometimes
customer_reviews.text: When i purchased this tablet i was expecting a fast tablet with fast response when you swipe thru apps search online and so one, but unless you have it in power management the tablet is kind of slow sometimes. Battery last but my nexus 5 is much better then the tablet not only in battery but experience overall. It overheats sometimes on the top a bit but not to much. I had a galaxy tab 2 Samsung 2 years ago but i never encountered this and it seemed faster back then then this. Has some cool features but i think i will switch brand soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nordstarx

customer_reviews.title: versatile and lovely
customer_reviews.text: The tablet does just what it advertises. great processing speed, beautiful screen quality, good battery length, and the dock makes typing much, much easier. With a 3rd party app you can put it on your phone's data plan or use wifi. The only downside I saw was in accessing certain base things. Setting up the background images was a bit of a pain. Little things. Nothing major. It was very, VERY much worth the money. It holds up well against any other tablet I've worked with and better than some.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After a year and a half - this is still my "go to" device
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to read books and watch movies, tv shows, etc. on a screen that was larger than a Kindle as my eyes are bad. I couldn't be happier! I have my books set to sepia pages and large type and I am one happy reader. I average a book every one to two days. I can also watch hulu or netflix and don't feel like I miss a thing. The device lasts about 8 hours before it needs a charge which is about the same as when I got it. The only thing I don't like is having to wipe off the fingerprints. I would highly recommend this device to ANYONE!
customer_reviews.author: oucat5

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tablets
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has all the features I needed in a portable "computer" both with and without the keyboard. The screen is beautiful and easy to view, with websites, videos, and text! The keyboard really improves it's use for real office work. The battery in the tablet lasts about 10 hours of heavy use and 3 days with sporadic use. When you plug it into the keyboard it will charge up the tablet completely or if it is used from the beginning (after you finish charging both the tablet and base) I got almost a week out of it with off and on use each day.
customer_reviews.author: WKF.2

customer_reviews.title: Good, but one annoying problem.
customer_reviews.text: I like the OS, the keyboard attachment is awesome, and I love using it most of the time. However, sometimes the touch screen will think it's already being pressed on so all I can do is zoom in or out depending on the app I have open. Nothing else will respond. Then other times the touchscreen doesn't respond at all. When this happens I have to play around with the power button until it turns off by itself because I am unable to hit the prompt that asks if I want it to power off. If this keeps happening I will return it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Lostman

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. I am on my second one. I dropped the first one on tile and the only complaint I have wast that it was near impossible to replace the glass. The second one seemed to have some bugs with the touch screen (it was refurbished so I was just going with it) but the firmware updates fixed all this. A great tablet with a lot of apps. The only app I think is reasonable but not offered is an Amazon Prime Video app... but this is more politics on Amazon's part than a problem with Asus.
customer_reviews.author: James Dubuisson

customer_reviews.title: It isn't the latest and greatest, but it's still pretty grand
customer_reviews.text: Androids are a little quirky getting used to as compared to a laptop, but that being said I wouldn't trade my Asus for another brand. My mother has a Galaxy 2, and one thing I don't like when trying to show her how to do things is the proprietary way things are done by Samsung as opposed to other Android phones and tablets. I had to do some searching to get a User Manual for this, but since finding it even if I don't need it I have a little more sense of security.
customer_reviews.author: S. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Has its Bugs
customer_reviews.text: Ive had the tf300 for 2 years when it started acting like it had a ghost in it, opening up apps on its own, typing letters like yyyyyy to the point I had trouble turning it even off. I liked it and bought another only to have it start doing the same thing on and off and no I was not Hacked. Bought the tf701 everything was fine but was not impressed with it and got a Samsung Note 10.1 2014. Update...I did seem to find a fix to my problem with the ghost inputs. 2 days so far with me in control of my tablet.
customer_reviews.author: scottr

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Buy, buy buy! Fast, great battery life, and Asus support is very responsive with firmware updates. Get a case with a stand, for better handling. I couldn't stand the fingerprints and wasn't sure if I would use a stylus. I got the micro fiber stylus and I actually prefer it now. So much easier than hauling my laptop on vacations. I have 64 gb with added micro SD, but hard to fill up the first 32.I don't think you'll even need the extended memory for quite a while. Great purchase and affordable. Who needs an iPad?
customer_reviews.author: R. Grisi

customer_reviews.title: mistake
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I have a defective tablet, but it's had glitches from the beginning. Most of the time,pages don't completely load. It takes forever, with flickering, and switching screens while it does load. I've done multiple factory resets. I'm not a techie person, so all the tricks to get better performance don't mean a lot to me. But I shouldn't have to. The product should work. Every time I look at it, I seethe over the money I wasted on this product.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tablet
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this tablet. I would buy it for my parents or kids, too. It's easy to navigate around and get where you want to go. Screen is fantastic, very bright, and great high-definition. Have used it for a few weeks now, and have had no problems. I use it mostly to read magazines, email and play games. It's a great tablet for a great price - go buy one yourself and see what I'm talking about. There is no bleed-through on the edges of the screen, as some have suggested. I dont know where that came from, but I have not noticed anything to that effect.
customer_reviews.author: WMATT007

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet once you get rid of the stock OS
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tablet. Great battery life and super fast charging thanks to the 15V charger. No issues with the screen and it has a microSD reader. PRO: Super fast charging with the Asus chargers. Easy to unlock via Asus provided app. Running CM 10.1 (Jelly Bean 4.2.2) custom rom. CONS: You need the Asus charger that provides 15V. USB charging is about 10% per 2 hours with the screen off. Charging from empty to full takes about 1 hour with the charger (a big plus).
customer_reviews.author: Carlos F.

customer_reviews.title: Very excited and at peace!
customer_reviews.text: Over the top with joy!! Ibwas excited I found one exactly like my original one that was stolen from me..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Unstable. I had trouble, mostly with the browser, running through ghost commands. Asus service replaced the screen, and the complete unusability was replacee with marginal usability. I called tech support again, and they helped me factory reboot, but the problem is still there. I use it mostly to brows internet, and this is where I have yet to find a browser that is stable. It locks up, fails to respond, responds slowly, etc. I expect more from thisdevice.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #375

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. I don't know why someone would spend $600 - 800 on an apple when this thing is fantastic at $340. But to each his own I guess. The camera is great but no flash. Web speeds are pretty good, the glitches are in the os not the device so as far as that goes it is good. I can stream video, surf effortlessly view and alter Office docs what more could you want? My laptop now stays home never leaving it's spot on the table. The portable computing is completely accomplished with this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Plechaty

customer_reviews.title: it runs abit slow sometimes picture quality is great. What i dislike the most is it disconnects ...
customer_reviews.text: it runs abit slow sometimes picture quality is great. What i dislike the most is it disconnects from wifi constantly and if it does connect there is not enough signal going through my laptop and anything else that is hooked up to our wifi works perfectly and fyi our router is in our room where i mainly use the tablet but its still not enough signal. Even then when the tablet says its linked to the wifi there still is no internet so i have to restart the tablet in order for it to work for about 30mins then loses connection again.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet for the price but I bought it back ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tablet for the price but I bought it back in 2012. Works great as long as you have a good wifi connection. Storage is good, and it takes micro sd cards. The optional keyboard gives another 10 hours of battery, but i didn't go for it. all in all, a good price for a good tablet as long as you don't expect LTE cause you not gonna get it. WIFI only.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet, but fragile, and DIFFICULT to get repair if you need it
customer_reviews.text: Thin - light - decent performance. HOPE YOU NEVER NEED SUPPORT FROM ASUS!!! OMG what a ridiculous mess to get a cracked digitizer replaced - several different runs for the same model, had to search and search for someone to fix it and ultimately never got it fixed. Which is a shame, because I wish that I could... ***GET A CASE OR PROTECTION WITH THIS UNIT*** its fragile and difficult to find repair.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Williams

customer_reviews.title: Adobe Flash support ????
customer_reviews.text: In product reviw writes : Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich OS with Adobe Flash support : this is not true?? when i try to find adobe flash i found out that google has stop suport the adobe flash from the android.....now i am searching in the internet and trying to instalid from external sites ..with clear warning for damaging my new tablet...is that worty??? why ASSUS lie about it?? other than this i am very happy with this tablet
customer_reviews.author: spiros

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the first two months
customer_reviews.text: As this was a new model I waited to review - the tablet was great for the first two months - LOVED it! But after a couple of months the display started blinking off/on. So far I've sent it in to ASUS for repair twice (and going back for the third time today) - but they still haven't been able to fix it. This time I'm posting a video on YOUTUBE to show them what it's doing. Recommendation: from what I've experienced and have seen posted on other websites you may want to wait awhile before purchasing this model.
customer_reviews.author: grncreek

customer_reviews.title: A really nice tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Asus Transformer TF300 to replace a Toshiba Thrive and I like the lighter, thinner Asus tablet much better than the heavier, thicker Toshiba Thrive. The Asus 32GB tablet has a great 10.1 inch display and is very responsive to the touch which makes it perfect for all the reasons a person would buy a tablet. I definitely recommend this tablet to anyone looking for a nice all-purpose tablet at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah, loved it till tablet is no longer usable. Seems there's a factory glitch that it shuts itself off and on every couple minutes. Searched internet and found out this is a major problem with other users. According to them ASUS is not doing anything to fix the problem. Poor customer service. Spent over $400 on this and now it's useless. If I had only spent $100 and this started happening after a year of use I could understand but this is ridiculous that on that expensive of a tablet that is not usable after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet w. Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Can't think of anything I don't like about this tablet. Adding the keyboard makes it just like a netbook. Does everything I have asked it to do so far. Love the long battery life and all of the apps from Android. The extra sdhc card slots are awesome giving me so much more storage than on the iPad. Also, nice not to have to use iTunes to load and unload music, etc. What a pain that is. Just copy my files right onto the external card and its good to go. Keep up the great work Asus!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: glass is super fragile
customer_reviews.text: Was okay at first but the glass is super fragile. I received it with a hairline crack. This version does not have gorilla glass and is paper thin. Any minor amount of flexing will crack it. Kudos to Amazon for their prompt and easy return policy. I ended up buying and Acer Icona (with Gorilla Glass) and have been using it happily ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harris

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I got this fella to read pdf files ( for work ), browse the web, and read e-books. It handles these tasks marvellously. I have also used it to edit and post digital photos, listen to music, and do light correspondence. Perhaps a bit heavier than other tablets ( I also have keyboard/battery pack ), but seems to run forever with adequate performance. The wi-fi seems a bit pokey compared to my other devices. But not enough to really complain about it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this tablet. Once I figured out that it is not really a keyboardless netbook, I have really become quite fond of it. It is my only computer and suffices quite well for social media, a few games, banking and letter writting. I can Hangout with the grand kids without problem and shop Amazon like a wiz. I did purchase the external keyboard and really enjoued the extended battery life. But as a stand alone item its just great, for me.
customer_reviews.author: Notypst

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent tablet for the price.The Tegra 3 processor is ok, not impressed by it.though.I bought this tablet for the purpose of have adobe flash player but have found out android 4.0 and up does not support flash player,so its not the tablets companies fault.It is strange most all video on the internet requires flash player,go figure. The browser crashing from time toi time is one of the few problems with the tablet. All in all it is a decent tablet.
customer_reviews.author: bigcityguy

customer_reviews.title: Issue with Touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Tablet looks very good until I have a problems with touch screen. After about 4 weeks of using screen at top right part become occasionally unresponsive. Several times per days like lugs or something. I experienced these problems in different applications even on the main screen. After doing the reset option and a hard restart I was getting annoyed with the tablet. Non responsive, random clicking... just after 30 days... so I can not return it to amazon. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Thorough research picked a winner
customer_reviews.text: Thorough research picked a winner in this ASUS 32 GB transformer. We added the Mobile Dock for xtra battery life and a real keyboard; and added a 32GB micro SDHC card for plenty of storage. We now hate picking up the laptop because of weight and have quit traveling with it. But it and our desktop are much better for wordprocessing and photo editing. The Transformer's excellent camera did yeoman's duty on our Panama Canal cruise trip and is our default travel device.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Received and it wouldn't charge. So bought new charger, still wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Antony L Parks

customer_reviews.title: Typical Asus High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my wife as a Christmas present. I selected this product because I already have an Asus TF300 tablet. It has proven itself to be a very reliable product. Since I have had no problems with the one I have had for about a year, why would I try any other brand when buying one for my wife? She is thrilled with it and uses it just about every day. I will probably be looking at Asus laptops in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: keyboard docking station "buggy" from the start
customer_reviews.text: This tablet lasted me all of 11 days before I sent it back for a refund. When I got it, I connected the tablet to the docking station and charged it overnight. Tablet worked flawlessly, but the keyboard docking station kept giving me problems. Sometimes it worked fine: both would be fully charged, I would un-dock tablet and use it, re-dock and the docking station would recharge the tablet like it's supposed to work. Other times, I would do the same thing and the docking station would immediately go from a full charge to zero WITHOUT charging the tablet. Finally, the docking station just stopped taking a charge altogether.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: nice for it's time
customer_reviews.text: so obviously by now there are much better models of this tablet .. but for its time it was quite a gem ... only reason i will take away a star ... is the keyboard ... i found that it causes the battery to drain out much faster than expected. when the tablet is by itself .. it sleeps for a considerable time ... but when the tablet is plugged into the keyboard .. i find the battery drains even faster ... go figure
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great when it's working
customer_reviews.text: Apparently these tablets are not built to last. Great when it's working, but the screen started doing crazy things like stopping and starting on its own, flashing from one site to another & unable to navigate anywhere. I've basically stopped using it and I really miss it because I really loved it when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: jjfg

customer_reviews.title: Love This Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I had a Le Pan II and the screen cracked so instead of having it repaired, I decided to get this tablet. It does a lot more then my previous tablet such as, I can take screen captures with it, it has a regular USB port to attach an external hard drive, a HDMI port for the TV to watch Netflix, Hulu Plus, etc. and has a mobile dock to use it as a laptop. The touch also screen work well. This is the best tablet that I haver ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Costumer99

customer_reviews.title: very nice product
customer_reviews.text: the asus tablet has been very nice to use the last couple months. i needed a tablet that i could use micro SD cards and one that had a mini hdmi port. to this date the only concern i have is the way the charging plug sticks directly out of the bottom of the unit. it makes it hard to sit with the unit in your lap on the couch and have the charger plugged in. it does have far superior battery life than my previous acer tablet had.
customer_reviews.author: In Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Tablet now for about four months and am very happy with my purchase. The touch screen is fantastic in this unit. The screen colors are vivid and crisp. Does a great jog staying connected to the Wifi signal and the bluetooth works great too. It also seems to be fairly fast loading web pages too. This tablet charges fast too. It will fully charged after an hour and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Ted

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived quickly and in good condition. I use this mainly for surfing the net and streaming movies/TV from Netflix. Works well. I've had no problems or complaints. As with all electronics, I wish the battery life was better, but I also tend to have my settings at less than optimal for sparing the battery, so it's partially my fault. This is a good tablet that functions well for my intended purposes. Pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gllags

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: Basically as advertised- not new but no functional defects- except that the non-OEM charger that was sent doesn't work well. The charger would power on/power off during charging making the tablet give that annoying beep about every 6 minutes until I turned the tablet completely off to charge it. Using my old OEM charger and it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Gester

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Transformer TF300
customer_reviews.text: After much research on many tablets I decided on this tablet. I am glad I did. I really love it. The display is beautiful. It's light,also you get 32GB flash storage, micro SD card slot and micro HDMI port,Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich OS. All for under $380.00. I had my heart set on an I pad until I seen the price of the 16g. This tablet offers so much more storage. Also (like the I pad)Front and rear cameras for face-to-face video chats and on-the-go video and picture capturing.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Anything More Than $30
customer_reviews.text: I can watch Netflix on here for about 2 hours and then I have to reboot it because it freezes up. More trouble than its worth. You're better off buying someone's used smartphone without a SIM card and connecting it to WiFi. This thing will just frustrate the daylights out of you.
customer_reviews.author: Slickflip

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TABLET AT GREAT PRICE
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has everything you can imagine and is very easy to use!! With Google Play you have tons of apps to download same as Apple store and the fact that this tablet has built in 32 GB memory and a micro SD card it gives you UNLIMITED storage!! The one thing i can say is a little off is the low volume when using headphones but i have recently ordered a noise canceling headphone to see if it will help drown out any outside noise and make sound quality better. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet at a great price!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Franco

customer_reviews.title: Asus Tablet T300
customer_reviews.text: I now have had it for a month and am beginning to get a handle on how to use it. The android operating system is a little different then Microsoft and Apple computers and one has to adjust. I am glad I purchased this Asus T300 tablet over the Apple i-Pad for it not only saved me a ton of money I can also syn many more items with my Microsoft computers. Highly recommend anyone to purchase one of these - I know you too will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in SD

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Tablet for an Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm really loving the Transformer Pad. It's great for reading ebooks, web browsing, gaming, productivity apps, just about anything you can think of. I would wholeheartedly recommend this product to someone who's interested in a high quality tablet but doesn't want to spend $500 or more for something with less memory unless you break the bank and no built-in expandability (I'm looking at you, iPad).
customer_reviews.author: M. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Best machine for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Great price for an awesome product. We use this for work and very satisfied with it. Very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful so far
customer_reviews.text: I am more of a pessimist when it comes to technology, since I'm a huge geek and love my two laptops, but so far this little device has done nothing but impress me. It surfs the web better than i had hoped but i hadnt played around with a tablet for a few years, also it has great gaming capabilities for such a slime device. I have had a few problems with games but i would assume that is due to the app itself and nothing to do with the tablet. I will report back in about 3-6 months with a progress report and a final verdict.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Keene

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet....  if you haven't already, get the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this tablet from an Acer A500. I like the feel and size of this tablet plus it is also great on battery life. I also picked up the keyboard which I am typing with right now. It turns your tablet into a netbook and for some people may eliminate the need for a laptop or computer entirely. I also picked one up for my father as well (with the keyboard of course). My wife has an IPad but this thing is much better. Mine was cheaper by about 100 bucks and I now have a total of 96 GB of memory for this device. My wife only has 16.
customer_reviews.author: TomH

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: One of the people I worked with let me use their ASUS TF300 and I loved the simplicity and portability of this device. Not to mention that I "need" a keyboard because I am not thrilled with using the touch-screen keyboard. And the benefit of an additional battery in the keyboard dock....great idea. I didn't want Apple or Microsoft OS's and this Android fits the bill very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Matzinger

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money on an iPad
customer_reviews.text: I sold my ipad when i got this. The android OS is a little more hands on. But its nice to be able to down load my pics and music to a sd card and put it right on the ASUS tablet. No itunes, no accounts need to be made. No credit card in the Apple data base to be hacked. I have the control.The asus tablet is fast and smart. I have a friend that has the tf101. It is the same size and dimentions. He has dropped it numerous times and its never broke so its strong and sturdy. I'm done with apple products FOREVER!!! Go ASUS and Android!!!
customer_reviews.author: DIKLYU

customer_reviews.title: EXCELENT SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Hey I really am impressed so far. I think its a great overall Tablet. It has a great screen for the price. I have no complaints so far, and its very flexible. I would recomend it over the kindle Fire HD on a price basis and the fact that its OS is set up so its more open and flexible than the OS on the kindle. Sorry Amazon but I didn't like the restraints on the kindle just to have a fancier screen.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K. Fish

customer_reviews.title: A very good deal
customer_reviews.text: I'm just sorry that the Asus tablet is not able to download the Optimum widget to access the tv. I contacted them and maybe one day soon they'll do one. The tablet is very fast but appears to have a glitch in that it reboots for no reason occasionally. I'm saving up for the keyboard and case now, unless someone can tell me that any full size blue tooth keyboard will work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nora A. Deret

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have used this non-stop for about six weeks and have been nothing but happy. For standard web browsing, light games, streaming media, email, facebook etc. it's incredibly convenient. And I love that it fits in my purse. I have been able to view and even edit Microsoft documents stored in cloud storage. The screen image is gorgeous and it is easy to use right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a tablet that isn't too big and bulky, but not too small of being much use. I use it mostly with the keyboard and portfolio stand case to give me keyboard capability, to extend the battery life. It also gives me usb ports. Be aware that when you are charging the keyboard, the tablet won't always charge to 100%. You may want to charge them separately.
customer_reviews.author: MarthaMomZ

customer_reviews.title: mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Asus tablet and this one is soooo much slower than my first one. It freezes and I have to force power it off. It is better than other tablets I'veplayed with but mediocre for the Asus name. I just use it for minor internet and games and such and it works fine. I would not recommend if you need a fast tablet for work though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bower

customer_reviews.title: A very much loved gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one as a birthday present for my boyfriend. He was a very upset apple user before, had too much problem with his i-phone etc. Loved this one. The screen is amazing, the resolution is so much better than I expected. Also, I apparently did not read it well, but had the HDMI connection available too. If you consider buying and Android tablet, I can recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent perfomance vs price
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was a gift for my son. I liked. Pros: 1) The Price is good. 2) 4 cores. Is fast. 3)APPs android excelent.Full aplications 4)The display is very good. 5)The connection wifi is fast. 6)The multilenguaje. Cons 1) Signal the wifi is short. 2)The not incluided APP: Antivirus and parental control. I recomended this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The tablet arrived right on time and is light weight and a perfect size for someone that struggles to read their phone screen. It is quiet, has polaris office and other helpful apps already installed. It and runs quickly, with a long battery life. My only criticism is that the product description did not indicate whether or not the keyboard/docking station were included. Many of the reviews I read about the Transformer tablet (in general, not specifying which model) indicated that the docking station is included, but it is not included with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet, but........
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet a couple weeks ago, and it works beautifully, no problems so far, however when I check the size if the internal SD card it says 12.99 GB, what's going on here? Isn't this a 32GB tablet, that's one of the reasons I bought it in the first place. This is misrepresentation, I feel like i`ve been hoodwinked and that doesn't go down well with me. Amazon has some answering to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hepburn

customer_reviews.title: An excellent little product
customer_reviews.text: It's not the newest nor the slickest...but it's a fantastic little machine. It's a wee bit under powered when running multiple applications but it does a great job on the basics: watch a video? No problem. E-mail? Easy. Cameras? Both are great. If you need a simple too for home use...this is it. If you want a tablet for work, consider something with a bit more horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tablet for the Perfect Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Transformer Prime but returned it because of the GPS issues. This tablet (TF300) was cheaper than the Transformer Prime and I honestly cannot tell the difference. I absolutely love it and I am THRILLED with my purhcase. It's thin, it's not too heavy, it looks great, and has an 8MP rear camera with a quad-core processor. I couldn't ask for better specs.
customer_reviews.author: KLDB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Asus T300!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this used/refurbished and it has been excellent. The tablet arrived looking brand new and the battery life is amazing! I purchased a used dock with it and have not even turned on my laptop once since receiving this combo. I have downloaded books, movies, and tons of free apps. I can't think of anything negative to say about it other than I hate having to clean fingerprints off the screen (even with a screen protector)! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: A very well designed tablet. Very responsive, looks pretty and seems very stable. It has not crashed on me once. Battery life is decent. My wife reads books and uses the Internet on it. I use it for email and for connecting into my clients' computers via an RDP client. My favorite thing so far has to be watching the baseball game from my Slingbox while lying in my hammock in the backyard. Excellent picture. The only minor criticism I have is that it has a good amount of glare when used outdoors but I haven't seen a tablet yet that doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoose

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Never had a hitch with it always finds my wireless network or any other. Batterie lasts maybe 2 hours of 3d gaming. I don't know if rooting it would make it better as I haven't felt the need too. Of course I never overclocked my P.C.s either. It said used when I bought it but I couldn't tell. Great seller, Great tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: The Best Tablet I Have Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablet for the simple fact it does everthing, its better than an IPad, unless you just prefer and IPad. I don't like it because I thought I was getting a tablet the size of an IPad but I got one just a lil bigger than my Kindle Fire. The tablet is like a wide screen (10.1) not happy about that so I gave it to my husband as a birthday gift. I HIGHLY recommend it for all the great features it has but be sure you are getting the size tablet that you request. I have never had any problems with my orders from Amazon and I'm sure I will get what I asked for.
customer_reviews.author: Katty Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good .
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it brandnew since the product first available on Amazone 8 months ago, it looks good ( not as good as Ipad) the touch screen sensitive is good and smooth , the quality so far so good... my kids use it to play games and watch youtube videos alot . Ok , i dont have much experient or knowledge with other tablets but base on how my children used it for months , i rate it 4*.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed. Now its just sitting in the drawer
customer_reviews.text: The screen has a mind of its own. Jumping all over the place. Its unusable! I needed it for school, so I don't have to carry around the heavy laptop. I'm disappointed. Now its just sitting in the drawer. Waste of money. And my friend has one and its the same complaint. Obviously a manufacturer defect. I should be refunded! Seriously
customer_reviews.author: Kerry-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Best Android Tablet on the Market
customer_reviews.text: After reading hundreds of reviews on line about android tablets and then testing out several decent ones, I bought this Asus tablet. Have to say, it was a damn good purchase. Even my wife (a die hard apple fan) likes it better than her iPad. The Asus TF300 is fast, responsive and well laid out (ICS).
customer_reviews.author: Alphabull

customer_reviews.title: Keeps rebooting
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for a year and then it started rebooting constantly. I have tried resetting it to the factory setting and removing added programs in case of operating system incompatibility but have had no luck fixing it. Some of the posts I have read suggest that the switch is faulty and I do notice that it does not switch off cleanly and that the machine will reboot when you touch the case. At the moment this tablet has turned into an expensive paperweight which is disappointing. I would never buy another Asus product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Rosemarie J Wild

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of reading before choosing this tablet, previously bought a hp touchpad from the fire sale, it was ok, extremely heavy, slow, and just no good software. I originally wanted the Samsung Tab 2 but after reading some reviews and doing a little research for average price the Asus TF300 is the most bang for the buck, after playing with it for a few days I know I made the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Corey T. Levert

customer_reviews.title: In love with it!
customer_reviews.text: Asus is a very respectful company and its MB products are one of the top in the computer market. Its tablets; like this one; is very useful and I do really like it. Unlike Samsun's tablets, Asus' tablet has more useful and handy I/O like the USB mini port. If you add the keyboard; ASUS Transformer Pad Mobile Dock TF300T; then you'd get extra regular USB port.
customer_reviews.author: CA DDlg

customer_reviews.title: Bad Asus!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my wife for Christmas a year and a half ago based on a recommendation from a friend. My wife has had nothing but trouble with it since then. It acts like it's broken most of the time and does some really weird stuff. She does not like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Swifty00

customer_reviews.title: Best tablets ever!!
customer_reviews.text: These Asus transformer tablets are the best for the price! The whole family has 1 and we all LOVE them! They are great for using in place of waiting to boot up the computer. We use them as readers (they are a little on the heavy side for this, admittedly), for quick info look up such as gaming or IMDB, entertainment and it is so easy since we have android phones. I highly recommend them to anybody looking for a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Wood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet, true that I have not owned the other ones personally but I was doing a lot of research for this one and I'm very satisfied with it, the screen viewing angle is very good, performance is snappy, it can run advanced games with it's tegra 3 processor, camera resolution is also very good and can be upgraded to android jelly bean 4.2
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to get a new tablet and chose the TF300. I was split on OS's between Windows and Android, but went with Android since I was familiar with the architecture. The processor isn't the most powerful on the market (1.2 ghz), but the overall device is worth it. I love the screen size and storage capacity for the price. I would recommend this device. Primary uses: Web Browsing Media Streaming (Youtube & Netflix) and personal media (Movies & Comic books)
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Mine is working very bad. Permanently freezing
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. For my dad and me. Mine is working very bad. Permanently freezing, downloading too long. But my dad's one is working pretty good. I am thinking that mine was ether refurbished or used one.
customer_reviews.author: glaz

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a top tier tablet able to compete with the new iPad. It does. Unless you're absolutely enslaved to Apple, you need to consider this product. ASUS has a more expensive tablet with a more durable case (metal), but it is basically a ruggedized version of this model.
customer_reviews.author: Hammerhead64

customer_reviews.title: Very good tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have several desktop, laptop and netbook computers but this is my first tablet. My phone is an android so I understood the basics of how to operate. I like the size and use it instead of my laptop. It's not perfect but I would recommend to a friend. Thanks to my sister Lu for the gift certificate to Amazon that helped made this purchase possible!
customer_reviews.author: WillieT49

product_meta.title: ASUS TF300T-A1-BL 10.1-Inch 16GB Tablet (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Size:16 GB| Color:BlueBlue / 10.1" WXGA (1280x800), 350 nits, IPS with Soda Lime glass / NVIDIA Tegra 3 (1.2GHz) ARM Quad-core / 1GB DDR3 / NVIDIA Tegra 3 / 16GB Flash / No Optical Drive / Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) / 802.11BGN / 1.2MP & 8.0MP / Bluetooth 3.0 / Polymer 22W/h (10 Hours) / No keyboard (tablet) / 1 Year North America Warranty

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich, 10.1 inches Display
16 GB Flash Memory, 1 GB RAM Memory

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,365 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
